description: From Middle English handemayde, hand-maide, handmaide, handmayd, hand mayde, hand-mayde, haundmaid, hondemayde, hondmaide, hond-mayde; equivalent to hand +â€Ž maid, the first component in the sense of "ready at hand".

entries.meaning: (now historical) A maid that waits at hand; a female servant or attendant.
